post_text:
Hello Atmosphere Community

As you know, due to COVID-19, the Class of 2020 was not able to experience all that Atmosphere has to offer its 8th graders. Prom, career exploration, DC trip, Costa Rica trip, graduation at Columbia University, and much more had to be canceled.

Atmosphere created the following video to honor the Class of 2020. This video tries to capture some of what was lost and to give it back to the amazing graduates and their families. The title "Forever Connected" speaks to how the scholars finished their Atmosphere careers in remote instruction and our hope that our "connection" during this pandemic will endure far into the future.

Thanks to Mr. McCall and Mr. Roman for putting this together.

Enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5jfpEmdQ7_Y

YOUTUBE.COM

post_text:
Congratulations to Atmosphere 8th graders for their High School acceptances. Angel Colin was accepted to The Bronx High School of Science, Alexis Sanchez was accepted to Horace Mann School with a full scholarship and Brooklyn Tech, and Charles Ampah was accepted to Horace Mann with financial aid. This is a remarkable outcome considering only 4,265 Specialized High Schools offers were made in 2020 and that only 298 of those offers went to Latinx students. Atmosphere students earned 2 of those 298 offers (0.67%) despite making up only 107 out of 31,200 (or 0.003%) of all Latinx 8th grade students across New York City.

We are so proud of all our students in the graduating Class of 2020!
text:

Angel Colin was accepted to The Bronx High School of Science, Alexis Sanchez was accepted to Horace Mann School with a full scholarship and Brooklyn Tech, and Charles Ampah was accepted to Horace Mann with financial aid. This is a remarkable outcome considering only 4,265 Specialized High Schools offers were made in 2020 and that only 298 of those offers went to Latinx students. Atmosphere students earned 2 of those 298 offers (0.67%) despite making up only 107 out of 31,200 (or 0.003%) of all Latinx 8th grade students across New York City.

We are so proud of all our students in the graduating Class of 2020!

post_text:
Each year, 28,000 NYC students apply to the Specialized High Schools (9 highly selective public high schools throughout the city), and only 5,000 are admitted. Of those 5,000 accepted students, only 300 are Latino. For the second year in a row, an Atmosphere 8th grade student has earned one of those 300 offers. This accomplishment is made even more remarkable since this is only Atmosphere's second 8th grade graduating class.

Atmosphere congratulates:

Alex Carmona
Atmosphere Academy - Class of 2018
Fiorello LaGuardia HS of Music, Art, and Performing Arts - Class of 2022

and

Alejandro Villanueva
Atmosphere Academy - Class of 2019
HS for Mathematics, Science, and Engineering at City College - Class of 2023

Despite this extraordinary outcome, in future years, Atmosphere hopes to have even more of its 8th graders gain entry to the Specialized High Schools in order to help increase the number of Black and Latino students served by these schools, which remains at just 8.3% combined in 2019.
text:

Of those 5,000 accepted students, only 300 are Latino. For the second year in a row, an Atmosphere 8th grade student has earned one of those 300 offers. This accomplishment is made even more remarkable since this is only Atmosphere's second 8th grade graduating class.

Atmosphere congratulates:

Atmosphere Academy - Class of 2018
Fiorello LaGuardia HS of Music, Art, and Performing Arts - Class of 2022

and

Alejandro Villanueva
Atmosphere Academy - Class of 2019
HS for Mathematics, Science, and Engineering at City College - Class of 2023

Despite this extraordinary outcome, in future years, Atmosphere hopes to have even more of its 8th graders gain entry to the Specialized High Schools in order to help increase the number of Black and Latino students served by these schools, which remains at just 8.3% combined in 2019.

post_text: Congratulations to Tiana Fortune and Isabella Vargas from the Class of 2021 on being accepted to The TEAK Fellowship! They were selected out of a competitive group of over 300 applicants to be 1 of 50 fellows in TEAK's next class. The TEAK Fellowship unlocks access to outstanding education and transformative experiences for exceptional NYC students, who use these opportunities to change their lives and the world around them.

post_text:
Hello Atmosphere Academy Students, Staff and Families,
Our Parent Alliance has arranged for a fundraiser to benefit their many upcoming student events. Please support them by dining at our local Applebee's (76 West 225th Street) on December 20th. If you present the attached flyer to your server, the Parent Alliance will receive 10% of your bill.

Please spread the word.
Thank you.

Hola Atmósfera Academia Estudiantes, Personal y Familias,
Nuestra Alianza de Padres ha organizado un evento para recaudar fondos en beneficio de sus muchos eventos estudiantiles. Por favor apóyelos al cenar en nuestro local de Applebee's (76 West 225th Street) el 20 de diciembre. Si presenta el folleto adjunto a su servidor, la Alianza de Padres recibirá el 10% de su factura.

Pasa la voz.
Gracias.

post_text:
It's that time of the year! 📚📖

The book fair will take place from Tuesday, May 15 through Thursday, May 17 at 22 Marble Hill Ave.

We are also excited to announce that Scholastic now has an additional payment option, called eWallet. EWallet allows you to set up an account online with your credit card, and your child can shop the fair with your account ID.

Please use our homepage URL to shop our fair online as well. There are titles available for ages birth-adult. You may also set up your eWallet using this URL address link:

https://bookfairs.scholastic.com/bookfairs/cptoolkit/homepage.do?method=homepage&url=atmosphereacademychartersch

#LITeracy

post_text: 2018 is the inaugural year of Atmosphere Academy’s Career Exploration program. The goal of the program is to expose Atmosphere students to future career paths, fields, and professions. Corporate and individual partners are needed to help place Atmosphere students in work sites that match their interests. Please contact the school at 718-696-0470 if you are interested in volunteering to host students in May and June.

post_text:
Atmosphere's first ever "Living the Dream" Event in collaboration with SAR Academy and Riverdale Jewish Center in honor of Martin Luther King

SAR 8th grade students and Atmosphere 8th grade students went to workshops together and conducted a joint panel discussion about the meaning of the Civil Rights Movement and how we can measure the progress that has been made and what progress is still needed.

post_text:
Only two more days to purchase! Campaign ends on Wednesday.

"Atmosphere Academy is a public charter middle school in the Bronx. One of our Core Values is to be civic and give back to our community. The Rockets advisory of 6th grade students has designed a T-Shirt to raise money for St. Jude's Children's Hospital. With every T-Shirt we sell money will be donated toward the fight against cancer. The more we sell, the more we help!"

Yearbook Update:

Parents, please send in a baby photo for the "Guess that scholar!" page that will be featured in the yearbook this year!

If you are in the 7th grade please send your photo to aestevez@atmosphereacademy.org

If you are in 6th grade please send your photo to kfilardo@atmosphereacademy.org

Please make sure to put your student's name in the subject! Thank you and we can't wait to see the photos :D

post_text:
Atmosphere Academy School Blog
by Felicia Thompson (Atmosphere Parent)

Hello Atmosphere!

I have to say congratulations to all of you, teachers, students and staff. You guys have done great. This has been a good start for Atmosphere and I hope we will continue to do exceptional.

Have to s/o Ms. Distangilo for the great party! Had fun as well as the students I'm sure.

Dont forget the summer camp that Atmosphere has for students as well as summer school. And the school garden(which is growing nicely♥). For more info on the summer camp and summer school I'm sure the ladies in the front office will gladly help you.♥
For those that will not be back for next year we will miss you.
Good luck.

Atmosphere have a great summer!!!!;-)
- character is doing the right thing when no-one is looking
J.C. Wells

post_text:
Atmosphere's Electives Showcase was a great way to end the year by showing off our different talents and everything we learned in elective classes this year.

Students shared out and demonstrated their skills in Arabic, Boxing, Dance, Yoga, Japanese, Piano, Voice, Drums, Guitar, Video Games, Jiu Jitsu, and Drama.

Thanks to all our elective partners: Riverdale Music Studio, Ms. Loftis, Little Flower Yoga, Fluent City, Star Boxing, East Coast United Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, and CIZE Dance Workout.
text:
Atmosphere's Electives Showcase was a great way to end the year by showing off our different talents and everything we learned in elective classes this year.

Students shared out and demonstrated their skills in Arabic, Boxing, Dance, Yoga, Japanese, Piano, Voice, Drums, Guitar, Video Games, Jiu Jitsu, and Drama.

Thanks to all our elective partners: Riverdale Music Studio, Ms. Loftis, Little Flower Yoga, Fluent City, Star Boxing, East Coast United Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, and CIZE Dance Workout.

post_text: On June 21st, Atmosphere welcomed over 100 incoming 6th grade families. This year set a new record for applications to our school. Thank you to the parents and students for choosing Atmosphere!

post_text: Atmosphere visited the Intrepid Air and Space Museum during Fleet Week and just before the Memorial Day holiday. Students learned about the 4 forces of flight, the history of the space shuttle, the sacrifices of those that served in the armed forces, and life/work on an aircraft carrier.
text: Atmosphere visited the Intrepid Air and Space Museum during Fleet Week and just before the Memorial Day holiday. Students learned about the 4 forces of flight, the history of the space shuttle, the sacrifices of those that served in the armed forces, and life/work on an aircraft carrier.

post_text: Atmosphere students visited Westchester Land Trust in April to begin their investigation of land stewardship. They tended the garden, created a sound map, identified native and invasive species, and engaged in other stewardship activities. They will visit again in May.
text: Atmosphere students visited Westchester Land Trust in April to begin their investigation of land stewardship. They tended the garden, created a sound map, identified native and invasive species, and engaged in other stewardship activities. They will visit again in May.

post_text: Today Atmosphere visited Central Park. We identified different bird species, conducted a turtle study at the pond, and visited the zoo.
text: Today Atmosphere visited Central Park. We identified different bird species, conducted a turtle study at the pond, and visited the zoo.

post_text: During March and April, Atmosphere students attended Friday after school and Saturday classes to continue and accelerate their preparation for the state test. There were classes in math, English, and mindfulness along with plenty of pizza and snacks. Thanks to Atmosphere's amazing families for all of their support and commitment!
text: During March and April, Atmosphere students attended Friday after school and Saturday classes to continue and accelerate their preparation for the state test. There were classes in math, English, and mindfulness along with plenty of pizza and snacks. Thanks to Atmosphere's amazing families for all of their support and commitment!

post_text:
On 3/1/16, Atmosphere Academy, the NYC Department of Youth and Community Development, the NYC Compass Program, and Westhab, Inc. are launching a new 3-year after school enrichment program that will support Atmosphere students every day of the week from 2:50 to 5:50 with individualized tutoring, small group test preparation, social-emotional support and learning, educational gaming, foreign language classes, Yoga and mindfulness, music, art, robotics, exciting trips, animal therapy with dogs, and countless other offerings.

This summer, the program will continue as a summer camp and will include horse back riding as well as fun and educational summer trips.

We want every Atmosphere family to sign for this new after school by 3/1/16 and are willing to address any transportation concerns parents may have. There will be a mandatory parent meeting this Saturday at 9 am in the new library during Saturday school with Atmosphere administration and Westhab staff. Parents should make every effort to attend!
text:
On 3/1/16, Atmosphere Academy, the NYC Department of Youth and Community Development, the NYC Compass Program, and Westhab, Inc. are launching a new 3-year after school enrichment program that will support Atmosphere students every day of the week from 2:50 to 5:50 with individualized tutoring, small group test preparation, social-emotional support and learning, educational gaming, foreign language classes, Yoga and mindfulness, music, art, robotics, exciting trips, animal therapy with dogs, and countless other offerings.

This summer, the program will continue as a summer camp and will include horse back riding as well as fun and educational summer trips.

We want every Atmosphere family to sign for this new after school by 3/1/16 and are willing to address any transportation concerns parents may have. There will be a mandatory parent meeting this Saturday at 9 am in the new library during Saturday school with Atmosphere administration and Westhab staff. Parents should make every effort to attend!

post_text:
Atmosphere Academy School Blog
by Felicia Thompson (Atmosphere Parent)

Hello Atmosphere!

Hope everyone is doing well after that "blizzard." We've had worse, I think. I'm sure there'll be another one before winter ends.

So this blog will be short and sweet. I want to ask parents, students, and staff of Atmosphere their opinions about the presidential elections. What do you think about each candidate's platform and what they are promising to do for the country? What are they saying about each other and how are they conducting themselves? What are they saying about what is going on overseas and what happened in Michigan?

Tell me your thoughts. What topics are important to you? What do you want to see happen when the next president is in office?

Atmosphere student government, this goes out to you as well. This presidential election is almost the same thing that happened when " campaigning " for your position. What say you?

- Every accomplishment starts with the decision to try. -Gail Devers
text:
Atmosphere Academy School Blog
by Felicia Thompson (Atmosphere Parent)

Hello Atmosphere!

Hope everyone is doing well after that "blizzard." We've had worse, I think. I'm sure there'll be another one before winter ends.

What do you think about each candidate's platform and what they are promising to do for the country? What are they saying about each other and how are they conducting themselves? What are they saying about what is going on overseas and what happened in Michigan?

Tell me your thoughts. What topics are important to you? What do you want to see happen when the next president is in office?

Atmosphere student government, this goes out to you as well. This presidential election is almost the same thing that happened when " campaigning " for your position. What say you?

- Every accomplishment starts with the decision to try. -Gail Devers

Atmosphere Academy Public Charter Schools added 9 new photos.
January 20, 2016 ·

To help promote professional collaboration and learning, two teams of Atmosphere staff visited Dr. Powderly and the HCC staff on 1/12/16 and 1/20/16. Atmosphere staff was able to meet with and observe HCC staff. They discussed and modeled the implementation of effective strategies and best practices in each work area (instructional and non-instructional). On an annual basis, HCC is one the highest performing middle schools in New York state. We thank them for hosting us so graciously.
